statement.tex:
\text{Find }\frac{dy}{dx}\text{ for the following}\\
y = \cos^{-1}\Bigg( \frac{1 - x^2}{1+ x^2}\Bigg) , 0\lt x \lt 1

step.context: \text{Is the formula on the previous step, of }\\ \text{any use in solving the current question?}
step.tex:
x= \tan \frac{y}{2}\\
\Rightarrow \tan^{-1} x = \frac{y}{2}\\
\Rightarrow y = 2 . \tan^{-1} x\\
\text{Diffrentiating y we get:}\\
\Rightarrow \frac{dy}{dx} = 2 .\Bigg( \frac{d(\tan^{-1} x)}{dx} \Bigg) \\ \quad = \frac{2}{1 + x^2} \\
